Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: 6. The competent authorities shall determine whether and how consolidation is to be carried out in the following cases:

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: (a) where, in the opinion of the competent authorities, an institution exercises a significant influence over one or more institutions or financial institutions, but without holding a participation or other capital ties in these institutions; and

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: (b) where two or more institutions or financial institutions are placed under single management other than pursuant to a contract or clauses of their memoranda or articles of association.

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: In particular, the competent authorities may permit, or require use of, the method provided for in Article 12 of Directive 83/349/EEC. That method shall not, however, constitute inclusion of the undertakings concerned in consolidated supervision.

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: 7. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify conditions according to which consolidation shall be carried out in the cases referred to in paragraphs 2 to 6 of this Article.

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2016.

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 18: Methods for prudential consolidation
Content: 8. Where consolidated supervision is required pursuant to Article 111 of Directive 2013/36/EU, ancillary services undertakings and asset management companies as defined in point (5) of Article 2 of Directive 2002/87/EC shall be included in consolidations in the cases, and in accordance with the methods, laid down in this Article.

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: 1. An institution, a financial institution or an ancillary services undertaking which is a subsidiary or an undertaking in which a participation is held, need not to be included in the consolidation where the total amount of assets and off-balance sheet items of the undertaking concerned is less than the smaller of the following two amounts:

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: (a) EUR 10 million;

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: (b) 1 % of the total amount of assets and off-balance sheet items of the parent undertaking or the undertaking that holds the participation.

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: 2. The competent authorities responsible for exercising supervision on a consolidated basis pursuant to Article 111 of Directive 2013/36/EU may on a case-by-case basis decide in the following cases that an institution, financial institution or ancillary services undertaking which is a subsidiary or in which a participation is held need not be included in the consolidation:

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: (a) where the undertaking concerned is situated in a third country where there are legal impediments to the transfer of the necessary information;

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: (b) where the undertaking concerned is of negligible interest only with respect to the objectives of monitoring institutions;

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: (c) where, in the opinion of the competent authorities responsible for exercising supervision on a consolidated basis, the consolidation of the financial situation of the undertaking concerned would be inappropriate or misleading as far as the objectives of the supervision of credit institutions are concerned.

Article: Article 19: Entities excluded from the scope of prudential consolidation
Content: 3. Where, in the cases referred to in paragraph 1 and point (b) of paragraph 2, several undertakings meet the criteria set out therein, they shall nevertheless be included in the consolidation where collectively they are of non-negligible interest with respect to the specified objectives.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 1. The competent authorities shall work together, in full consultation:

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: (a) in the case of applications for the permissions referred to in Article 143(1), Article 151(4) and (9), Article 283, Article 312(2) and Article363 respectively submitted by an EU parent institution and its subsidiaries, or jointly by the subsidiaries of an EU parent financial holding company or EU parent mixed financial holding company, to decide whether or not to grant the permission sought and to determine the terms and conditions, if any, to which such permission should be subject;

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: (b) for the purposes of determining whether the criteria for a specific intragroup treatment as referred to in Article 422(9) and Article 425(5) complemented by the EBA regulatory technical standards referred to in Article 422(10) and Article 425(6) are met.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: Applications shall be submitted only to the consolidating supervisor.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: The application referred to in Article 312(2), shall include a description of the methodology used for allocating operational risk capital between the different entities of the group. The application shall indicate whether and how diversification effects are intended to be factored in the risk measurement system.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 2. The competent authorities shall do everything within their power to reach a joint decision within six months on:

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: (a) the application referred to in point (a) of paragraph 1;

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: (b) the assessment of the criteria and the determination of the specific treatment referred to in point (b) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: This joint decision shall be set out in a document containing the fully reasoned decision which shall be provided to the applicant by the competent authority referred to in paragraph 1.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 3. The period referred to in paragraph 2 shall begin: (a) on the date of receipt of the complete application referred to in point

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: (a) of paragraph 1 by the consolidating supervisor. The consolidating supervisor shall forward the complete application to the other competent authorities without delay;

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: (b) on the date of receipt by competent authorities of a report prepared by the consolidating supervisor analysing intragroup commitments within the group.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 4. In the absence of a joint decision between the competent authorities within six months, the consolidating supervisor shall make its own decision on point (a) of paragraph 1. The decision of the consolidating supervisor shall not limit the powers of the competent authorities under Article 105 of Directive 2013/36/EU.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: The decision shall be set out in a document containing the fully reasoned decision and shall take into account the views and reservations of the other competent authorities expressed during the six months period.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: The decision shall be provided to the EU parent institution, the EU parent financial holding company or to the EU parent mixed financial holding company and the other competent authorities by the consolidating supervisor.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: If, at the end of the six-month period, any of the competent authorities concerned has referred the matter to EBA in accordance with Article 19 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010, the consolidating supervisor shall defer its decision on point (a) of paragraph 1 of this Article and await any decision that EBA may take in accordance with Article 19(3) of that Regulation on its decision, and shall take its decision in conformity with the decision of EBA. The six-month period shall be deemed the conciliation period within the meaning of that Regulation. EBA shall take its decision within one month. The matter shall not be referred to EBA after the end of the six-month period or after a joint decision has been reached.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 5. In the absence of a joint decision between the competent authorities within six months, the competent authority responsible for the supervision of the subsidiary on an individual basis shall make its own decision on point (b) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: The decision shall be set out in a document containing the fully reasoned decision and shall take into account the views and reservations of the other competent authorities expressed during the six-month period.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: The decision shall be provided to the consolidating supervisor that informs the EU parent institution, the EU parent financial holding company or the EU parent mixed financial holding company.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: If, at the end of the six-month period, the consolidating supervisor has referred the matter to EBA in accordance with Article 19 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010, the competent authority responsible for the supervision of the subsidiary on an individual basis shall defer its decision on point (b) of paragraph 1 of this Article and await any decision that EBA may take in accordance with Article 19(3) of that Regulation on its decision, and shall take its decision in conformity with the decision of EBA. The six-month period shall be deemed the conciliation period within the meaning of that Regulation. EBA shall take its decision within one month. The matter shall not be referred to EBA after the end of the six-month period or after a joint decision has been reached.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 6. Where an EU parent institution and its subsidiaries, the subsidiaries of an EU parent financial holding company or an EU parent mixed financial holding company use an Advanced Measurement Approach referred to in Article 312(2) or an IRB Approach referred to in Article 143 on a unified basis, the competent authorities shall allow the qualifying criteria set out in Articles 321 and 322 or in Part Three, Title II, Chapter 3, Section 6 respectively to be met by the parent and its subsidiaries considered together, in a way that is consistent with the structure of the group and its risk management systems, processes and methodologies.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 7. The decisions referred to in paragraphs 2, 4 and 5 shall be recognised as determinative and applied by the competent authorities in the Member States concerned.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: 8. EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards to specify the joint decision process referred to in point (a) of paragraph 1 with regard to the applications for permissions referred to in Article 143(1), Article 151(4) and (9), Article 283, Article 312(2), and Article 363 with a view to facilitating joint decisions.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: EBA shall submit those draft implementing technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2014.

Article: Article 20: Joint decisions on prudential requirements
Content: Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: 1. Upon application of an EU parent institution or an EU parent financial holding company or EU parent mixed financial holding company or a sub-consolidating subsidiary of an EU parent institution or an EU parent financial holding company or EU parent mixed financial holding company, the consolidating supervisor and the competent authorities responsible for the supervision of subsidiaries of an EU parent institution or an EU parent financial holding company or EU parent mixed financial holding company in a Member State shall do everything within their power to reach a joint decision on whether the conditions in points (a) to (d) of Article 8(1) are met and identifying a single liquidity sub-group for the application of Article 8.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: The joint decision shall be reached within six months after submission by the consolidating supervisor of a report identifying single liquidity sub-groups on the basis of the criteria laid down in Article 8. In the event of disagreement during the sixmonth period, the consolidating supervisor shall consult EBA at the request of any of the other competent authorities concerned. The consolidating supervisor may consult EBA on its own initiative.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: The joint decision may also impose constraints on the location and ownership of liquid assets and require minimum amounts of liquid assets to be held by institutions that are exempt from the application of Part Six.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: The joint decision shall be set out in a document containing the fully reasoned decision which shall be submitted to the parent institution of the liquidity subgroup by the consolidating supervisor.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: 2. In the absence of a joint decision within six months, each competent authority responsible for supervision on an individual basis shall take its own decision.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: However, any competent authority may during the six-month period refer to EBA the question whether the conditions in points (a) to (d) of Article 8(1) are met. In that case, EBA may carry out its non-binding mediation in accordance with Article 31(c) of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010 and all the competent authorities involved shall defer their decisions pending the conclusion of the non-binding mediation. Where, during the mediation, no agreement has been reached by the competent authorities within three months, each competent authority responsible for supervision on an individual basis shall take its own decision taking into account the proportionality of benefits and risks at the level of the Member State of the parent institution and the proportionality of benefits and risks at the level of the Member State of the subsidiary. The matter shall not be referred to EBA after the end of the six-month period or after a joint decision has been reached.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: The joint decision referred to in paragraph 1 and the decisions referred to in the second subparagraph of this paragraph shall be binding.

Article: Article 21: Joint decisions on the level of application of liquidity requirements
Content: 3. Any relevant competent authority may also during the sixmonth period consult EBA in the event of a disagreement on the conditions in points (a) to (d) of Article 8(3). In that case, EBA may carry out its non-binding mediation in accordance with Article 31(c) of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010, and all the competent authorities involved shall defer their decisions pending the conclusion of the non-binding mediation. Where, during the mediation, no agreement has been reached by the competent authorities within three months, each competent authority responsible for supervision on an individual basis shall take its own decision.

Article: Article 22: Sub-consolidation in cases of entities in third countries
Content: Subsidiary institutions shall apply the requirements laid down in Articles 89 to 91 and Parts Three and Four on the basis of their sub-consolidated situation if those institutions, or the parent undertaking where it is a financial holding company or mixed financial holding company, have an institution or a financial institution as a subsidiary in a third country, or hold a participation in such an undertaking.

Article: Article 23: Undertakings in third countries
Content: For the purposes of applying supervision on a consolidated basis in accordance with this Chapter, the terms "investment firm", "credit institution", financial institution', and "institution" shall also apply to undertakings established in third countries, which, were they established in the Union, would fulfil the definitions of those terms in Article 4.

Article: Article 24: Valuation of assets and off-balance sheet items
Content: 1. The valuation of assets and off-balance sheet items shall be effected in accordance with the applicable accounting framework.

Article: Article 24: Valuation of assets and off-balance sheet items
Content: 2. By way of derogation from paragraph 1, competent authorities may require that institutions effect the valuation of assets and off-balance sheet items and the determination of own funds in accordance with the international accounting standards as applicable under Regulation (EC) No 1606/2002.

Title: TITLE I: ELEMENTS OF OWN FUNDS

Article: Article 25: Tier 1 capital
Content: The Tier 1 capital of an institution consists of the sum of the Common Equity Tier 1 capital and Additional Tier 1 capital of the institution.

Section: Section 1: Common Equity Tier 1 items and instruments

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: Article 26 Common Equity Tier 1 items

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 1. Common Equity Tier 1 items of institutions consist of the following:

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) capital instruments, provided that the conditions laid down in Article 28 or, where applicable, Article 29 are met;

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (b) share premium accounts related to the instruments referred to in point (a);

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (c) retained earnings;

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (d) accumulated other comprehensive income;

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (e) other reserves;

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (f) funds for general banking risk.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: The items referred to in points (c) to (f) shall be recognised as Common Equity Tier 1 only where they are available to the institution for unrestricted and immediate use to cover risks or losses as soon as these occur.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 2. For the purposes of point (c) of paragraph 1, institutions may include interim or year-end profits in Common Equity Tier 1 capital before the institution has taken a formal decision confirming the final profit or loss of the institution for the year only with the prior permission of the competent authority.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: The competent authority shall grant permission where the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) those profits have been verified by persons independent of the institution that are responsible for the auditing of the accounts of that institution;

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (b) the institution has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the competent authority that any foreseeable charge or dividend has been deducted from the amount of those profits.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: A verification of the interim or year-end profits of the institution shall provide an adequate level of assurance that those profits have been evaluated in accordance with the principles set out in the applicable accounting framework.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 3. Competent authorities shall evaluate whether issuances of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments meet the criteria set out in Article 28 or, where applicable, Article 29. With respect to issuances after 28 June 2013, institutions shall classify capital instruments as Common Equity Tier 1 instruments only after permission is granted by the competent authorities, which may consult EBA.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: For capital instruments, with the exception of State aid, that are approved as eligible for classification as Common Equity Tier 1 instruments by the competent authority but where, in the opinion of EBA, compliance with the criteria in Article 28 or, where applicable, Article 29, is materially complex to ascertain, the competent authorities shall explain their reasoning to EBA.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: On the basis of information from each competent authority, EBA shall establish, maintain and publish a list of all the forms of capital instruments in each Member State that qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 instruments. EBA shall establish that list and publish it for the first time by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: EBA may, after the review process set out in Article 80 and, where there is significant evidence of those instruments not meeting the criteria set out in Article 28 or, where applicable, Article 29, decide to remove non-State aid capital instruments issued after 28 June 2013 from the list and may make an announcement to that effect.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 4. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the meaning of foreseeable when determining whether any foreseeable charge or dividend has been deducted.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 26: Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: 1. Common Equity Tier 1 items shall include any capital instrument issued by an institution under its statutory terms provided that the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (a) the institution is of a type that is defined under applicable national law and which competent authorities consider to qualify as any of the following:

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (i) a mutual;

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (ii) a cooperative society;

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (iii) a savings institution;

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (iv) a similar institution;

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (v) a credit institution which is wholly owned by one of the institutions referred to in points (i) to (iv) and has approval from the relevant competent authority to make use of the provisions in this Article, provided that, and for as long as, 100 % of the ordinary shares in issue in the credit institution are held directly or indirectly by an institution referred to in those points;

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: (b) the conditions laid down in Articles 28 or, where applicable, Article 29, are met.

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: Those mutuals, cooperative societies or savings institutions recognised as such under applicable national law prior to 31 December 2012 shall continue to be classified as such for the purposes of this Part, provided that they continue to meet the criteria that determined such recognition.

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: 2. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the conditions according to which competent authorities may determine that a type of undertaking recognised under applicable national law qualifies as a mutual, cooperative society, savings institution or similar institution for the purposes of this Part.

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 27: Capital instruments of mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions or similar institutions...
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: 1. Capital instruments shall qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 instruments only if all the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) the instruments are issued directly by the institution with the prior approval of the owners of the institution or, where permitted under applicable national law, the management body of the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) the instruments are paid up and their purchase is not funded directly or indirectly by the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) the instruments meet all the following conditions as regards their classification:

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) they qualify as capital within the meaning of Article 22 of Directive 86/635/EEC;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) they are classified as equity within the meaning of the applicable accounting framework;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iii) they are classified as equity capital for the purposes of determining balance sheet insolvency, where applicable under national insolvency law;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (d) the instruments are clearly and separately disclosed on the balance sheet in the financial statements of the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (e) the instruments are perpetual;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (f) the principal amount of the instruments may not be reduced or repaid, except in either of the following cases:

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the liquidation of the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) discretionary repurchases of the instruments or other discretionary means of reducing capital, where the institution has received the prior permission of the competent authority in accordance with Article 77;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (g) the provisions governing the instruments do not indicate expressly or implicitly that the principal amount of the instruments would or might be reduced or repaid other than in the liquidation of the institution, and the institution does not otherwise provide such an indication prior to or at issuance of the instruments, except in the case of instruments referred to in Article 27 where the refusal by the institution to redeem such instruments is prohibited under applicable national law;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (h) the instruments meet the following conditions as regards distributions:

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) there is no preferential distribution treatment regarding the order of distribution payments, including in relation to other Common Equity Tier 1 instruments, and the terms governing the instruments do not provide preferential rights to payment of distributions;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) distributions to holders of the instruments may be paid only out of distributable items;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iii) the conditions governing the instruments do not include a cap or other restriction on the maximum level of distributions, except in the case of the instruments referred to in Article 27;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iv) the level of distributions is not determined on the basis of the amount for which the instruments were purchased at issuance, except in the case of the instruments referred to in Article 27;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (v) the conditions governing the instruments do not include any obligation for the institution to make distributions to their holders and the institution is not otherwise subject to such an obligation;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (vi) non-payment of distributions does not constitute an event of default of the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (vii) the cancellation of distributions imposes no restrictions on the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) compared to all the capital instruments issued by the institution, the instruments absorb the first and proportionately greatest share of losses as they occur, and each instrument absorbs losses to the same degree as all other Common Equity Tier 1 instruments;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (j) the instruments rank below all other claims in the event of insolvency or liquidation of the institution;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (k) the instruments entitle their owners to a claim on the residual assets of the institution, which, in the event of its liquidation and after the payment of all senior claims, is proportionate to the amount of such instruments issued and is not fixed or subject to a cap, except in the case of the capital instruments referred to in Article 27;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (l) the instruments are neither secured nor subject to a guarantee that enhances the seniority of the claim by any of the following:

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) the parent undertaking of the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iii) the parent financial holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iv) the mixed activity holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (v) the mixed financial holding company and its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (vi) any undertaking that has close links with the entities referred to in points (i) to (v);

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (m) the instruments are not subject to any arrangement, contractual or otherwise, that enhances the seniority of claims under the instruments in insolvency or liquidation.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: The condition set out in point (j) of the first subparagraph shall be deemed to be met, notwithstanding the instruments are included in Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 by virtue of Article 484 (3), provided that they rank pari passu.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: 2. The conditions laid down in point (i) of paragraph 1 shall be deemed to be met notwithstanding a write down on a permanent basis of the principal amount of Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: The condition laid down in point (f) of paragraph 1 shall be deemed to be met notwithstanding the reduction of the principal amount of the capital instrument within a resolution procedure or as a consequence of a write down of capital instruments required by the resolution authority responsible for the institution.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: The condition laid down in point (g) of paragraph 1 shall be deemed to be met notwithstanding the provisions governing the capital instrument indicating expressly or implicitly that the principal amount of the instrument would or might be reduced within a resolution procedure or as a consequence of a write down of capital instruments required by the resolution authority responsible for the institution.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: 3. The condition laid down in point (h)(iii) of paragraph 1 shall be deemed to be met notwithstanding the instrument paying a dividend multiple, provided that such a dividend multiple does not result in a distribution that causes a disproportionate drag on own funds.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: 4. For the purposes of point (h)(i) of paragraph 1, differentiated distributions shall only reflect differentiated voting rights. In this respect, higher distributions shall only apply to Common Equity Tier 1 instruments with fewer or no voting rights.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: 5. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following:

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) the applicable forms and nature of indirect funding of own funds instruments;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) whether and when multiple distributions would constitute a disproportionate drag on own funds;

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) the meaning of preferential distributions.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 28: Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: 1. Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar institutions shall qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 instruments only if the conditions laid down in Article 28 with modifications resulting from the application of this Article are met.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: 2. The following conditions shall be met as regards redemption of the capital instruments:

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: (a) except where prohibited under applicable national law, the institution shall be able to refuse the redemption of the instruments;

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: (b) where the refusal by the institution of the redemption of instruments is prohibited under applicable national law, the provisions governing the instruments shall give the institution the ability to limit their redemption;

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: (c) refusal to redeem the instruments, or the limitation of the redemption of the instruments where applicable, may not constitute an event of default of the institution.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: 3. The capital instruments may include a cap or restriction on the maximum level of distributions only where that cap or restriction is set out under applicable national law or the statute of the institution.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: 4. Where the capital instruments provide the owner with rights to the reserves of the institution in the event of insolvency or liquidation that are limited to the nominal value of the instruments, such a limitation shall apply to the same degree to the holders of all other Common Equity Tier 1 instruments issued by that institution.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: The condition laid down in the first subparagraph is without prejudice to the possibility for a mutual, cooperative society, savings institution or a similar institution to recognise within Common Equity Tier 1 instruments that do not afford voting rights to the holder and that meet all the following conditions:

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: (a) the claim of the holders of the non-voting instruments in the insolvency or liquidation of the institution is proportionate to the share of the total Common Equity Tier 1 instruments that those non-voting instruments represent;

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: (b) the instruments otherwise qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 instruments.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: 5. Where the capital instruments entitle their owners to a claim on the assets of the institution in the event of its insolvency or liquidation that is fixed or subject to a cap, such a limitation shall apply to the same degree to all holders of all Common Equity Tier 1 instruments issued by the institution.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: 6. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the nature of the limitations on redemption necessary where the refusal by the institution of the redemption of own funds instruments is prohibited under applicable national law.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 29: Capital instruments issued by mutuals, cooperative societies, savings institutions and similar...
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 30: Consequences of the conditions for Common Equity Tier 1 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: The following shall apply where, in the case of a Common Equity Tier 1 instrument, the conditions laid down in Article 28 or, where applicable, Article 29 cease to be met:

Article: Article 30: Consequences of the conditions for Common Equity Tier 1 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: (a) that instrument shall immediately cease to qualify as a Common Equity Tier 1 instrument;

Article: Article 30: Consequences of the conditions for Common Equity Tier 1 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: (b) the share premium accounts that relate to that instrument shall immediately cease to qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 items.

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: 1. In emergency situations, competent authorities may permit institutions to include in Common Equity Tier 1 capital instruments that comply at least with the conditions laid down in points (b) to (e) of Article 28(1) where all the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (a) the capital instruments are issued after 1 January 2014;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (b) the capital instruments are considered State aid by the Commission;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (c) the capital instruments are issued within the context of recapitalisation measures pursuant to State aid- rules existing at the time;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (d) the capital instruments are fully subscribed and held by the State or a relevant public authority or public-owned entity;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (e) the capital instruments are able to absorb losses;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (f) except for the capital instruments referred to in Article 27, in the event of liquidation, the capital instruments entitle their owners to a claim on the residual assets of the institution after the payment of all senior claims;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (g) there are adequate exit mechanisms of the State or, where applicable, a relevant public authority or public-owned entity;

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: (h) the competent authority has granted its prior permission and has published its decision together with an explanation of that decision.

Article: Article 31: Capital instruments subscribed by public authorities in emergency situations
Content: 2. Upon reasoned request by, and in cooperation with, the relevant competent authority, EBA shall consider the capital instruments referred to in paragraph 1 as equivalent to Common Equity Tier 1 instruments for the purposes of this Regulation.

Article: Article 32: Securitised assets
Content: 1. An institution shall exclude from any element of own funds any increase in its equity under the applicable accounting framework that results from securitised assets, including the following:

Article: Article 32: Securitised assets
Content: (a) such an increase associated with future margin income that results in a gain on sale for the institution;

Article: Article 32: Securitised assets
Content: (b) where the institution is the originator of a securitisation, net gains that arise from the capitalisation of future income from the securitised assets that provide credit enhancement to positions in the securitisation.

Article: Article 32: Securitised assets
Content: 2. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify further the concept of a gain on sale referred to in point (a) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 32: Securitised assets
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 32: Securitised assets
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: 1. Institutions shall not include the following items in any element of own funds:

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (a) the fair value reserves related to gains or losses on cash flow hedges of financial instruments that are not valued at fair value, including projected cash flows;

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (b) gains or losses on liabilities of the institution that are valued at fair value that result from changes in the own credit standing of the institution;

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (c) fair value gains and losses on derivative liabilities of the institution that result from changes in the own credit standing of the institution.

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: 2. For the purposes of point (c) of paragraph 1, institutions shall not offset the fair value gains and losses arising from the institution's own credit risk with those arising from its counterparty credit risk.

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: 3. Without prejudice to point (b) of paragraph 1, institutions may include the amount of gains and losses on their liabilities in own funds where all the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (a) the liabilities are in the form of bonds as referred to in Article 52(4) of Directive 2009/65/EC;

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (b) the changes in the value of the institution's assets and liabilities are due to the same changes in the institution's own credit standing;

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (c) there is a close correspondence between the value of the bonds referred to in point (a) and the value of the institution's assets;

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: (d) it is possible to redeem the mortgage loans by buying back the bonds financing the mortgage loans at market or nominal value.

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: 4. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify what constitutes close correspondence between the value of the bonds and the value of the assets, as referred to in point (c) of paragraph 3.

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 30 September 2013.

Article: Article 33: Cash flow hedges and changes in the value of own liabilities
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 34: Additional value adjustments
Content: Institutions shall apply the requirements of Article 105 to all their assets measured at fair value when calculating the amount of their own funds and shall deduct from Common Equity Tier 1 capital the amount of any additional value adjustments necessary.

Article: Article 35: Unrealised gains and losses measured at fair value
Content: Except in the case of the items referred to in Article 33, institutions shall not make adjustments to remove from their own funds unrealised gains or losses on their assets or liabilities measured at fair value.

Section: Section 3: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items, exemptions and alternatives

Subsection: Sub-Section 1: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 1. Institutions shall deduct the following from Common Equity Tier 1 items:

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) losses for the current financial year;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (b) intangible assets;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (c) deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (d) for institutions calculating risk-weighted exposure amounts using the Internal Ratings Based Approach (the IRB Approach), negative amounts resulting from the calculation of expected loss amounts laid down in Articles 158 and 159;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (e) defined benefit pension fund assets on the balance sheet of the institution;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (f) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by an institution of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments, including own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments that an institution is under an actual or contingent obligation to purchase by virtue of an existing contractual obligation;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (g) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities where those entities have a reciprocal cross holding with the institution that the competent authority considers to have been designed to inflate artificially the own funds of the institution;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (h) the applicable amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities where the institution does not have a significant investment in those entities;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (i) the applicable amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities where the institution has a significant investment in those entities;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (j) the amount of items required to be deducted from Additional Tier 1 items pursuant to Article 56 that exceeds the Additional Tier 1 capital of the institution;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (k) the exposure amount of the following items which qualify for a risk weight of 1 250 %, where the institution deducts that exposure amount from the amount of Common Equity Tier 1 items as an alternative to applying a risk weight of 1 250 %:

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (i) qualifying holdings outside the financial sector;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (ii) securitisation positions, in accordance with Article 243 (1)(b), Article 244(1)(b) and Article 258;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (iii) free deliveries, in accordance with Article 379(3);

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (iv) positions in a basket for which an institution cannot determine the risk weight under the IRB Approach, in accordance with Article 153(8);

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (v) equity exposures under an internal models approach, in accordance with Article 155(4).

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (l) any tax charge relating to Common Equity Tier 1 items foreseeable at the moment of its calculation, except where the institution suitably adjusts the amount of Common Equity Tier 1 items insofar as such tax charges reduce the amount up to which those items may be used to cover risks or losses.

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 2. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the application of the deductions referred to in points (a), (c), (e), (f), (h), (i) and (l) of paragraph 1 of this Article and related deductions referred to in points (a), (c), (d) and (f) of Article 56 and points (a), (c) and (d) of Article 66.

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 3. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the types of capital instruments of financial institutions and, in consultation with the European Supervisory Authority (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority) (EIOPA) established by Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24 November 2010 (1), of third country insurance and reinsurance undertakings, and of undertakings excluded from the scope of Directive 2009/138/EC in accordance with Article 4 of that Directive that shall be deducted from the following elements of own funds:

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) Common Equity Tier 1 items;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (b) Additional Tier 1 items;

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (c) Tier 2 items.

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 36: Deductions from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 37: Deduction of intangible assets
Content: Institutions shall determine the amount of intangible assets to be deducted in accordance with the following:

Article: Article 37: Deduction of intangible assets
Content: (a) the amount to be deducted shall be reduced by the amount of associated deferred tax liabilities that would be extinguished if the intangible assets became impaired or were derecognised under the applicable accounting framework;

Article: Article 37: Deduction of intangible assets
Content: (b) the amount to be deducted shall include goodwill included in the valuation of significant investments of the institution.

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: 1. Institutions shall determine the amount of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability that require deduction in accordance with this Article.

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: 2. Except where the conditions laid down in paragraph 3 are met, the amount of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability shall be calculated without reducing it by the amount of the associated deferred tax liabilities of the institution.

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: 3. The amount of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability may be reduced by the amount of the associated deferred tax liabilities of the institution, provided the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: (a) the entity has a legally enforceable right under applicable national law to set off those current tax assets against current tax liabilities;

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: (b) the deferred tax assets and the deferred tax liabilities relate to taxes levied by the same tax authority and on the same taxable entity.

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: 4. Associated deferred tax liabilities of the institution used for the purposes of paragraph 3 may not include deferred tax liabilities that reduce the amount of intangible assets or defined benefit pension fund assets required to be deducted.

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: 5. The amount of associated deferred tax liabilities referred to in paragraph 4 shall be allocated between the following:

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: (a) deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences that are not deducted in accordance with Article 48(1);

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: (b) all other deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability.

Article: Article 38: Deduction of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability
Content: Institutions shall allocate the associated deferred tax liabilities according to the proportion of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability that the items referred to in points (a) and (b) represent.

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: 1. The following items shall not be deducted from own funds and shall be subject to a risk weight in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three, as applicable:

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: (a) overpayments of tax by the institution for the current year;

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: (b) current year tax losses of the institution carried back to previous years that give rise to a claim on, or a receivable from, a central government, regional government or local tax authority.

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: 2. Deferred tax assets that do not rely on future profitability shall be limited to deferred tax assets arising from temporary differences, where all the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: (a) they are automatically and mandatorily replaced without delay with a tax credit in the event that the institution reports a loss when the annual financial statements of the institution are formally approved, or in the event of liquidation or insolvency of the institution;

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: (b) an institution is able under the applicable national tax law to offset a tax credit referred to in point (a) against any tax liability of the institution or any other undertaking included in the same consolidation as the institution for tax purposes under that law or any other undertaking subject to the supervision on a consolidated basis in accordance with Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: (c) where the amount of tax credits referred to in point (b) exceeds the tax liabilities referred to in that point, any such excess is replaced without delay with a direct claim on the central government of the Member State in which the institution is incorporated.

Article: Article 39: Tax overpayments, tax loss carry backs and deferred tax assets that do not rely on future...
Content: Institutions shall apply a risk weight of 100 % to deferred tax assets where the conditions laid down in points (a), (b) and (c) are met.

Article: Article 40: Deduction of negative amounts resulting from the calculation of expected loss amounts
Content: The amount to be deducted in accordance with point (d) of Article 36(1) shall not be reduced by a rise in the level of deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability, or other additional tax effects, that could occur if provisions were to rise to the level of expected losses referred to in Section 3 of Chapter 3 of Title II of Part Three.

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: 1. For the purposes of point (e) of Article 36(1), the amount of defined benefit pension fund assets to be deducted shall be reduced by the following:

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: (a) the amount of any associated deferred tax liability which could be extinguished if the assets became impaired or were derecognised under the applicable accounting framework;

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: (b) the amount of assets in the defined benefit pension fund which the institution has an unrestricted ability to use, provided that the institution has received the prior permission of the competent authority.

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: Those assets used to reduce the amount to be deducted shall receive a risk weight in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three, as applicable.

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: 2. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the criteria according to which a competent authority shall permit an institution to reduce the amount of assets in the defined benefit pension fund as specified in point (b) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 41: Deduction of defined benefit pension fund assets
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: For the purposes of point (f) of Article 36(1), institutions shall calculate holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments on the basis of gross long positions subject to the following exceptions:

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) institutions may calculate the amount of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments on the basis of the net long position provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the long and short positions are in the same underlying exposure and the short positions involve no counterparty risk;

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) either both the long and the short positions are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book;

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) institutions shall determine the amount to be deducted for direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of index securities by calculating the underlying exposure to own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments included in those indices;

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) institutions may net gross long positions in own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments resulting from holdings of index securities against short positions in own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments resulting from short positions in the underlying indices, including where those short positions involve counterparty risk, provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the long and short positions are in the same underlying indices;

Article: Article 42: Deduction of holdings of own Common Equity Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) either both the long and the short positions are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book.

Article: Article 43: Significant investment in a financial sector entity
Content: For the purposes of deduction, a significant investment of an institution in a financial sector entity shall arise where any of the following conditions is met:

Article: Article 43: Significant investment in a financial sector entity
Content: (a) the institution owns more than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments issued by that entity;

Article: Article 43: Significant investment in a financial sector entity
Content: (b) the institution has close links with that entity and owns Common Equity Tier 1 instruments issued by that entity;

Article: Article 43: Significant investment in a financial sector entity
Content: (c) the institution owns Common Equity Tier 1 instruments issued by that entity and the entity is not included in consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One but is included in the same accounting consolidation as the institution for the purposes of financial reporting under the applicable accounting framework.

Article: Article 44: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities and where an...
Content: Institutions shall make the deductions referred to in points (g), (h) and (i) of Article 36(1) in accordance with the following:

Article: Article 44: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities and where an...
Content: (a) holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments and other capital instruments of financial sector entities shall be calculated on the basis of the gross long positions;

Article: Article 44: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities and where an...
Content: (b) Tier 1 own-fund insurance items shall be treated as holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments for the purposes of deduction.

Article: Article 45: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: Institutions shall make the deductions required by points (h) and (i) of Article 36(1) in accordance with the following provisions:

Article: Article 45: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (a) they may calculate direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of the financial sector entities on the basis of the net long position in the same underlying exposure provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 45: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (i) the maturity of the short position matches the maturity of the long position or has a residual maturity of at least one year;

Article: Article 45: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (ii) either both the long position and the short position are held in the trading book or both are held in the nontrading book;

Article: Article 45: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (b) they shall determine the amount to be deducted for direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of index securities by calculating the underlying exposure to the capital instruments of the financial sector entities in those indices.

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 1. For the purposes of point (h) of Article 36(1), institutions shall calculate the applicable amount to be deducted by multiplying the amount referred to in point (a) of this paragraph by the factor derived from the calculation referred to in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (a) the aggregate amount by which the direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment exceeds 10 % of the aggregate amount of Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution calculated after applying the following to Common Equity Tier 1 items:

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (i) Articles 32 to 35;

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (ii) the deductions referred to in points (a) to (g), points (k) (ii) to (v) and point (l) of Article 36(1), excluding the amount to be deducted for deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences;

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (iii) Articles 44 and 45;

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (b) the amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of those financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment divided by the aggregate amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of those financial sector entities.

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 2. Institutions shall exclude underwriting positions held for five working days or fewer from the amount referred to in point (a) of paragraph 1 and from the calculation of the factor referred to in point (b) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 3. The amount to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be apportioned across all Common Equity Tier 1 instruments held. Institutions shall determine the amount of each Common Equity Tier 1 instrument that is deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 by multiplying the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the proportion specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (a) the amount of holdings required to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1;

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (b) the proportion of the aggregate amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment represented by each Common Equity Tier 1 instrument held.

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 4. The amount of holdings referred to in point (h) of Article 36(1) that is equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution after applying the provisions laid down in points (a)(i) to (iii) of paragraph 1 shall not be deducted and shall be subject to the applicable risk weights in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three and the requirements laid down in Title IV of Part Three, as applicable.

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 5. Institutions shall determine the amount of each Common Equity Tier 1 instrument that is risk weighted pursuant to paragraph 4 by multiplying the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the amount specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (a) the amount of holdings required to be risk weighted pursuant to paragraph 4;

Article: Article 46: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (b) the proportion resulting from the calculation in point (b) of paragraph 3.

Article: Article 47: Deduction of holdings of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments where an institution has a significant...
Content: For the purposes of point (i) of Article 36(1), the applicable amount to be deducted from Common Equity Tier 1 items shall exclude underwriting positions held for five working days or fewer and shall be determined in accordance with Articles 44 and 45 and Sub-section 2.

Subsection: Sub-Section 2: Exemptions from and alternatives to deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 1. In making the deductions required pursuant to points (c) and (i) of Article 36(1), institutions are not required to deduct the amounts of the items listed in points (a) and (b) of this paragraph which in aggregate are equal to or less than the threshold amount referred to in paragraph 2:

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) deferred tax assets that are dependent on future profitability and arise from temporary differences, and in aggregate are equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution calculated after applying the following:

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (i) Articles 32 to 35;

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (ii) points (a) to (h), points (k)(ii) to (v) and point (l) of Article 36(1), excluding deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences.

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (b) where an institution has a significant investment in a financial sector entity, the direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of that institution of the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments of those entities that in aggregate are equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution calculated after applying the following:

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (i) Article 32 to 35;

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (ii) points (a) to (h), points (k)(ii) to (v) and point (l), of Article 36(1) excluding deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences.

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 2. For the purposes of paragraph 1, the threshold amount shall be equal to the amount referred to in point (a) of this paragraph multiplied by the percentage referred to in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) the residual amount of Common Equity Tier 1 items after applying the adjustments and deductions in Articles 32 to 36 in full and without applying the threshold exemptions specified in this Article;

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: 3. For the purposes of paragraph 1, an institution shall determine the portion of deferred tax assets in the total amount of items that is not required to be deducted by dividing the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the amount specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (a) the amount of deferred tax assets that are dependent on future profitability and arise from temporary differences, and in aggregate are equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution;

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (b) the sum of the following:

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (i) the amount referred to in point (a);

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: (ii) the amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the own funds instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution has a significant investment, and in aggregate are equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution.

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
Content: The proportion of significant investments in the total amount of items that is not required to be deducted is equal to one minus the proportion referred to in the first subparagraph.

Article: Article 48: Threshold exemptions from deduction from Common Equity Tier 1 items
