Content: 4. The amounts of the items that are not deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be risk weighted at 250 %.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: 1. For the purposes of calculating own funds on an individual basis, a sub-consolidated basis and a consolidated basis, where the competent authorities require or permit institutions to apply method 1, 2 or 3 of Annex I to Directive 2002/87/EC, the competent authorities may permit institutions not to deduct the holdings of own funds instruments of a financial sector entity in which the parent institution, parent financial holding company or parent mixed financial holding company or institution has a significant investment, provided that the conditions laid down in points (a) to (e) of this paragraph are met:

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (a) the financial sector entity is an insurance undertaking, a reinsurance undertaking or an insurance holding company;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (b) that insurance undertaking, re-insurance undertaking or insurance holding company is included in the same supplementary supervision under Directive 2002/87/EC as the parent institution, parent financial holding company or parent mixed financial holding company or institution that has the holding;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (c) the institution has received the prior permission of the competent authorities;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (d) prior to granting the permission referred to in point (c), and on a continuing basis, the competent authorities are satisfied that the level of integrated management, risk management and internal control regarding the entities that would be included in the scope of consolidation under method 1, 2 or 3 is adequate;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (e) the holdings in the entity belong to one of the following:

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (i) the parent credit institution;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (ii) the parent financial holding company;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (iii) the parent mixed financial holding company;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (iv) the institution;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (v) a subsidiary of one of the entities referred to in points (i) to (iv) that is included in the scope of consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: The method chosen shall be applied in a consistent manner over time.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: 2. For the purposes of calculating own funds on an individual basis and a sub-consolidated basis, institutions subject to supervision on a consolidated basis in accordance with Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One shall not deduct holdings of own funds instruments issued by financial sector entities included in the scope of consolidated supervision, unless the competent authorities determine those deductions to be required for specific purposes, in particular structural separation of banking activities and resolution planning.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: Applying the approach referred to in the first subparagraph shall not entail disproportionate adverse effects on the whole or parts of the financial system in other Member States or in the Union as a whole forming or creating an obstacle to the functioning of the internal market.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: 3. Competent authorities may, for the purposes of calculating own funds on an individual or sub-consolidated basis permit institutions not to deduct holdings of own funds instruments in the following cases:

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (a) where an institution has a holding in another institution and the conditions referred to in points (i) to (v) are met:

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (i) the institutions fall within the same institutional protection scheme referred to in Article 113(7);

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (ii) the competent authorities have granted the permission referred to in Article 113(7);

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (iii) the conditions laid down in Article 113(7) are satisfied;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (iv) the institutional protection scheme draws up a consolidated balance sheet referred to in point (e) of Article 113(7) or, where it is not required to draw up consolidated accounts, an extended aggregated calculation that is, to the satisfaction of the competent authorities, equivalent to the provisions of Directive 86/635/EEC, which incorporates certain adaptations of the provisions of Directive 83/349/EEC or of Regulation (EC) No 1606/2002, governing the consolidated accounts of groups of credit institutions. The equivalence of that extended aggregated calculation shall be verified by an external auditor and in particular that the multiple use of elements eligible for the calculation of own funds as well as any inappropriate creation of own funds between the members of the institutional protection scheme is eliminated in the calculation. The consolidated balance sheet or the extended aggregated calculation shall be reported to the competent authorities no less frequently than the frequency laid down in Article 99;

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (v) the institutions included in an institutional protection scheme meet together on a consolidated or extended aggregated basis the requirements laid down in Article 92 and carry out reporting of compliance with those requirements in accordance with Article 99. Within an institutional protection scheme the deduction of the interest owned by co-operative members or legal entities, which are not members of the institutional protection scheme, is not required, provided that the multiple use of elements eligible for the calculation of own funds as well as any inappropriate creation of own funds between the members of the institutional protection scheme and the minority shareholder, when it is an institution, is eliminated.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: (b) where a regional credit institution has a holding in its central or another regional credit institution and the conditions laid down in points (a)(i) to (v) are met.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: 4. The holdings in respect of which deduction is not made in accordance with paragraph 1, 2 or 3 shall qualify as exposures and shall be risk weighted in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three, as applicable.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: 5. Where an institution applies method 1, 2 or 3 of Annex I to Directive 2002/87/EC, the institution shall disclose the supplementary own funds requirement and capital adequacy ratio of the financial conglomerate as calculated in accordance with Article 6 of and Annex I to that Directive.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: 6. EBA, EIOPA and the European Supervisory Authority (European Securities and Markets Authority) (ESMA) established by Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24 November 2010 (1) shall, through the Joint Committee, develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify for the purposes of this Article the conditions of application of the calculation methods listed in Annex I, Part II of Directive 2002/87/EC for the purposes of the alternatives to deduction referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: EBA, EIOPA and ESMA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 49: Requirement for deduction where consolidation, supplementary supervision or institutional...
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010, of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 and of Regulation (EU) No 1095/2010 respectively.

Article: Article 50: Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: The Common Equity Tier 1 capital of an institution shall consist of Common Equity Tier 1 items after the application of the adjustments required by Articles 32 to 35, the deductions pursuant to Article 36 and the exemptions and alternatives laid down in Articles 48, 49 and 79.

Section: Section 1: Additional Tier 1 items and instruments

Article: Article 51: Additional Tier 1 items
Content: Additional Tier 1 items shall consist of the following:

Article: Article 51: Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (a) capital instruments, where the conditions laid down in Article 52(1) are met;

Article: Article 51: Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (b) the share premium accounts related to the instruments referred to in point (a).

Article: Article 51: Additional Tier 1 items
Content: Instruments included under point (a) shall not qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 or Tier 2 items.

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 1. Capital instruments shall qualify as Additional Tier 1 instruments only if the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) the instruments are issued and paid up;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) the instruments are not purchased by any of the following:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) an undertaking in which the institution has a participation in the form of ownership, direct or by way of control, of 20 % or more of the voting rights or capital of that undertaking;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) the purchase of the instruments is not funded directly or indirectly by the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (d) the instruments rank below Tier 2 instruments in the event of the insolvency of the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (e) the instruments are neither secured nor subject to a guarantee that enhances the seniority of the claims by any of the following:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) the parent undertaking of the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iii) the parent financial holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iv) the mixed activity holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (v) the mixed financial holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (vi) any undertaking that has close links with entities referred to in points (i) to (v);

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (f) the instruments are not subject to any arrangement, contractual or otherwise, that enhances the seniority of the claim under the instruments in insolvency or liquidation;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (g) the instruments are perpetual and the provisions governing them include no incentive for the institution to redeem them;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (h) where the provisions governing the instruments include one or more call options, the option to call may be exercised at the sole discretion of the issuer;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the instruments may be called, redeemed or repurchased only where the conditions laid down in Article 77 are met, and not before five years after the date of issuance except where the conditions laid down in Article 78(4) are met;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (j) the provisions governing the instruments do not indicate explicitly or implicitly that the instruments would or might be called, redeemed or repurchased and the institution does not otherwise provide such an indication, except in the following cases:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the liquidation of the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) discretionary repurchases of the instruments or other discretionary means of reducing the amount of Additional Tier 1 capital, where the institution has received the prior permission of the competent authority in accordance with Article 77;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (k) the institution does not indicate explicitly or implicitly that the competent authority would consent to a request to call, redeem or repurchase the instruments;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (l) distributions under the instruments meet the following conditions:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) they are paid out of distributable items;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) the level of distributions made on the instruments will not be amended on the basis of the credit standing of the institution or its parent undertaking;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iii) the provisions governing the instruments give the institution full discretion at all times to cancel the distributions on the instruments for an unlimited period and on a non-cumulative basis, and the institution may use such cancelled payments without restriction to meet its obligations as they fall due;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iv) cancellation of distributions does not constitute an event of default of the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (v) the cancellation of distributions imposes no restrictions on the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (m) the instruments do not contribute to a determination that the liabilities of an institution exceed its assets, where such a determination constitutes a test of insolvency under applicable national law;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (n) the provisions governing the instruments require that, upon the occurrence of a trigger event, the principal amount of the instruments be written down on a permanent or temporary basis or the instruments be converted to Common Equity Tier 1 instruments;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (o) the provisions governing the instruments include no feature that could hinder the recapitalisation of the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (p) where the instruments are not issued directly by an institution, both the following conditions shall be met:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the instruments are issued through an entity within the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) the proceeds are immediately available to the institution without limitation and in a form that satisfies the conditions laid down in this paragraph.

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: The condition set out in point (d) of the first subparagraph shall be deemed to be met notwithstanding the fact that the instruments are included in Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 by virtue of Article 484(3), provided that they rank pari passu.

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 2. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify all the following:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) the form and nature of incentives to redeem;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) the nature of any write up of the principal amount of an Additional Tier 1 instrument following a write down of its principal amount on a temporary basis;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) the procedures and timing for the following:

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) determining that a trigger event has occurred;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) writing up the principal amount of an Additional Tier 1 instrument following a write down of its principal amount on a temporary basis;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (d) features of instruments that could hinder the recapitalisation of the institution;

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (e) the use of special purpose entities for indirect issuance of own funds instruments.

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 52: Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 53: Restrictions on the cancellation of distributions on Additional Tier 1 instruments and features...
Content: For the purposes of points (l)(v) and (o) of Article 52(1), the provisions governing Additional Tier 1 instruments shall, in particular, not include the following:

Article: Article 53: Restrictions on the cancellation of distributions on Additional Tier 1 instruments and features...
Content: (a) a requirement for distributions on the instruments to be made in the event of a distribution being made on an instrument issued by the institution that ranks to the same degree as, or more junior than, an Additional Tier 1 instrument, including a Common Equity Tier 1 instrument;

Article: Article 53: Restrictions on the cancellation of distributions on Additional Tier 1 instruments and features...
Content: (b) a requirement for the payment of distributions on Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments to be cancelled in the event that distributions are not made on those Additional Tier 1 instruments;

Article: Article 53: Restrictions on the cancellation of distributions on Additional Tier 1 instruments and features...
Content: (c) an obligation to substitute the payment of interest or dividend by a payment in any other form. The institution shall not otherwise be subject to such an obligation.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 1. For the purposes of point (n) of Article 52(1), the following provisions shall apply to Additional Tier 1 instruments:

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) a trigger event occurs when the Common Equity Tier 1 capital ratio of the institution referred to in point (a) of Article 92(1) falls below either of the following:

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) a level higher than 5,125 %, where determined by the institution and specified in the provisions governing the instrument;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) institutions may specify in the provisions governing the instrument one or more trigger events in addition to that referred to in point (a);

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) where the provisions governing the instruments require them to be converted into Common Equity Tier 1 instruments upon the occurrence of a trigger event, those provisions shall specify either of the following:

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the rate of such conversion and a limit on the permitted amount of conversion;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) a range within which the instruments will convert into Common Equity Tier 1 instruments;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (d) where the provisions governing the instruments require their principal amount to be written down upon the occurrence of a trigger event, the write down shall reduce all the following:

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the claim of the holder of the instrument in the insolvency or liquidation of the institution;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) the amount required to be paid in the event of the call or redemption of the instrument;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (iii) the distributions made on the instrument.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 2. Write down or conversion of an Additional Tier 1 instrument shall, under the applicable accounting framework, generate items that qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 items.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 3. The amount of Additional Tier 1 instruments recognised in Additional Tier 1 items is limited to the minimum amount of Common Equity Tier 1 items that would be generated if the principal amount of the Additional Tier 1 instruments were fully written down or converted into Common Equity Tier 1 instruments.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 4. The aggregate amount of Additional Tier 1 instruments that is required to be written down or converted upon the occurrence of a trigger event shall be no less than the lower of the following:

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) the amount required to restore fully the Common Equity Tier 1 ratio of the institution to 5,125 %;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) the full principal amount of the instrument.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 5. When a trigger event occurs institutions shall do the following:

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) immediately inform the competent authorities;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) inform the holders of the Additional Tier 1 instruments;

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) write down the principal amount of the instruments, or convert the instruments into Common Equity Tier 1 instruments without delay, but no later than within one month, in accordance with the requirement laid down in this Article.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 6. An institution issuing Additional Tier 1 instruments that convert to Common Equity Tier 1 on the occurrence of a trigger event shall ensure that its authorised share capital is at all times sufficient, for converting all such convertible Additional Tier 1 instruments into shares if a trigger event occurs. All necessary authorisations shall be obtained at the date of issuance of such convertible Additional Tier 1 instruments. The institution shall maintain at all times the necessary prior authorisation to issue the Common Equity Tier 1 instruments into which such Additional Tier 1 instruments would convert upon occurrence of a trigger event.

Article: Article 54: Write down or conversion of Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: 7. An institution issuing Additional Tier 1 instruments that convert to Common Equity Tier 1 on the occurrence of a trigger event shall ensure that there are no procedural impediments to that conversion by virtue of its incorporation or statutes or contractual arrangements.

Article: Article 55: Consequences of the conditions for Additional Tier 1 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: The following shall apply where, in the case of an Additional Tier 1 instrument, the conditions laid down in Article 52(1) cease to be met:

Article: Article 55: Consequences of the conditions for Additional Tier 1 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: (a) that instrument shall immediately cease to qualify as an Additional Tier 1 instrument;

Article: Article 55: Consequences of the conditions for Additional Tier 1 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: (b) the part of the share premium accounts that relates to that instrument shall immediately cease to qualify as an Additional Tier 1 item.

Section: Section 2: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: Institutions shall deduct the following from Additional Tier 1 items:

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (a) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by an institution of own Additional Tier 1 instruments, including own Additional Tier 1 instruments that an institution could be obliged to purchase as a result of existing contractual obligations;

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (b) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of the Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities with which the institution has reciprocal cross holdings that the competent authority considers to have been designed to inflate artificially the own funds of the institution;

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (c) the applicable amount determined in accordance with Article 60 of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of the Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities, where an institution does not have a significant investment in those entities;

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (d) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities where the institution has a significant investment in those entities, excluding underwriting positions held for five working days or fewer;

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (e) the amount of items required to be deducted from Tier 2 items pursuant to Article 66 that exceed the Tier 2 capital of the institution;

Article: Article 56: Deductions from Additional Tier 1 items
Content: (f) any tax charge relating to Additional Tier 1 items foreseeable at the moment of its calculation, except where the institution suitably adjusts the amount of Additional Tier 1 items insofar as such tax charges reduce the amount up to which those items may be applied to cover risks or losses.

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: For the purposes of point (a) of Article 56, institutions shall calculate holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments on the basis of gross long positions subject to the following exceptions:

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (a) institutions may calculate the amount of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments on the basis of the net long position provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the long and short positions are in the same underlying exposure and the short positions involve no counterparty risk;

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) either both the long and the short positions are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book;

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (b) institutions shall determine the amount to be deducted for direct, indirect or synthetic holdings of index securities by calculating the underlying exposure to own Additional Tier 1 instruments in those indices;

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (c) institutions may net gross long positions in own Additional Tier 1 instruments resulting from holdings of index securities against short positions in own Additional Tier 1 instruments resulting from short positions in the underlying indices, including where those short positions involve counterparty risk, provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (i) the long and short positions are in the same underlying indices;

Article: Article 57: Deductions of holdings of own Additional Tier 1 instruments
Content: (ii) either both the long and the short positions are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book;

Article: Article 58: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities and where an...
Content: Institutions shall make the deductions required by points (b), (c) and (d) of Article 56 in accordance with the following:

Article: Article 58: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities and where an...
Content: (a) holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments shall be calculated on the basis of the gross long positions;

Article: Article 58: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities and where an...
Content: (b) Additional Tier 1 own-fund insurance items shall be treated as holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments for the purposes of deduction.

Article: Article 59: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: Institutions shall make the deductions required by points (c) and (d) of Article 56 in accordance with the following:

Article: Article 59: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (a) they may calculate direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of the financial sector entities on the basis of the net long position in the same underlying exposure provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 59: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (i) the maturity of the short position matches the maturity of the long position or has a residual maturity of at least one year;

Article: Article 59: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (ii) either both the short position and the long position are held in the trading book or both are held in the nontrading book.

Article: Article 59: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (b) they shall determine the amount to be deducted for direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of index securities by calculating the underlying exposure to the capital instruments of the financial sector entities in those indices.

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 1. For the purposes of point (c) of Article 56, institutions shall calculate the applicable amount to be deducted by multiplying the amount referred to in point (a) of this paragraph by the factor derived from the calculation referred to in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (a) the aggregate amount by which the direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment exceeds 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution calculated after applying the following:

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (i) Article 32 to 35;

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (ii) points (a) to (g), points (k)(ii) to (v) and point (l) of Article 36(1), excluding deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences;

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (iii) Articles 44 and 45;

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (b) the amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Additional Tier 1 instruments of those financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment divided by the aggregate amount of all direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of those financial sector entities.

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 2. Institutions shall exclude underwriting positions held for five working days or fewer from the amount referred to in point (a) of paragraph 1 and from the calculation of the factor referred to in point (b) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 3. The amount to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be apportioned across all Additional Tier 1 instruments held. Institutions shall determine the amount of each Additional Tier 1 instrument to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 by multiplying the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the proportion specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (a) the amount of holdings required to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1;

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (b) the proportion of the aggregate amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Additional Tier 1 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment represented by each Additional Tier 1 instrument held.

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 4. The amount of holdings referred to in point (c) of Article 56 that is equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution after applying the provisions laid down in points (a)(i), (ii) and (iii) of paragraph 1 shall not be deducted and shall be subject to the applicable risk weights in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three and the requirements laid down in Title IV of Part Three, as applicable.

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: 5. Institutions shall determine the amount of each Additional Tier 1 instrument that is risk weighted pursuant to paragraph 4 by multiplying the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the amount specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (a) the amount of holdings required to be risk weighted pursuant to paragraph 4;

Article: Article 60: Deduction of holdings of Additional Tier 1 instruments where an institution does not have a...
Content: (b) the proportion resulting from the calculation in point (b) of paragraph 3.

Article: Article 61: Additional Tier 1 capital
Content: The Additional Tier 1 capital of an institution shall consist of Additional Tier 1 items after the deduction of the items referred to in Article 56 and the application of Article 79.

Article: Article 62: Tier 2 items
Content: Tier 2 items shall consist of the following:

Article: Article 62: Tier 2 items
Content: (a) capital instruments and subordinated loans where the conditions laid down in Article 63 are met;

Article: Article 62: Tier 2 items
Content: (b) the share premium accounts related to instruments referred to in point (a);

Article: Article 62: Tier 2 items
Content: (c) for institutions calculating risk-weighted exposure amounts in accordance with Chapter 2 of Title II of Part Three, general credit risk adjustments, gross of tax effects, of up to 1,25 % of risk-weighted exposure amounts calculated in accordance with Chapter 2 of Title II of Part Three;

Article: Article 62: Tier 2 items
Content: (d) for institutions calculating risk-weighted exposure amounts under Chapter 3 of Title II of Part Three, positive amounts, gross of tax effects, resulting from the calculation laid down in Articles 158 and 159 up to 0,6 % of risk-weighted exposure amounts calculated under Chapter 3 of Title II of Part Three.

Article: Article 62: Tier 2 items
Content: Items included under point (a) shall not qualify as Common Equity Tier 1 or Additional Tier 1 items.

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: Capital instruments and subordinated loans shall qualify as Tier 2 instruments provided that the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (a) the instruments are issued or the subordinated loans are raised, as applicable, and fully paid-up;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (b) the instruments are not purchased or the subordinated loans are not granted, as applicable, by any of the following:

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (i) the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (ii) an undertaking in which the institution has participation in the form of ownership, direct or by way of control, of 20 % or more of the voting rights or capital of that undertaking;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (c) the purchase of the instruments or the granting of the subordinated loans, as applicable, is not funded directly or indirectly by the institution;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (d) the claim on the principal amount of the instruments under the provisions governing the instruments or the claim of the principal amount of the subordinated loans under the provisions governing the subordinated loans, as applicable, is wholly subordinated to claims of all nonsubordinated creditors;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (e) the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, are neither secured, nor subject to a guarantee that enhances the seniority of the claim by any of the following:

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (i) the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (ii) the parent undertaking of the institution or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (iii) the parent financial holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (iv) the mixed activity holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (v) the mixed financial holding company or its subsidiaries;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (vi) any undertaking that has close links with entities referred to in points (i) to (v);

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (f) the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, are not subject to any arrangement that otherwise enhances the seniority of the claim under the instruments or subordinated loans respectively;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (g) the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, have an original maturity of at least five years;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (h) the provisions governing the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, do not include any incentive for their principal amount to be redeemed or repaid, as applicable by the institution prior to their maturity;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (i) where the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, include one or more call options or early repayment options, as applicable, the options are exercisable at the sole discretion of the issuer or debtor, as applicable;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (j) the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, may be called, redeemed or repurchased or repaid early only where the conditions laid down in Article 77 are met, and not before five years after the date of issuance or raising, as applicable, except where the conditions laid down in Article 78(4) are met;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (k) the provisions governing the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, do not indicate explicitly or implicitly that the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, would or might be called, redeemed, repurchased or repaid early, as applicable by the institution other than in the insolvency or liquidation of the institution and the institution does not otherwise provide such an indication;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (l) the provisions governing the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, do not give the holder the right to accelerate the future scheduled payment of interest or principal, other than in the insolvency or liquidation of the institution;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (m) the level of interest or dividend payments, as applicable, due on the instruments or subordinated loans, as applicable, will not be amended on the basis of the credit standing of the institution or its parent undertaking;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (n) where the instruments are not issued directly by an institution, or where the subordinated loans are not raised directly by an institution, as applicable, both of the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (i) the instruments are issued or subordinated loans are raised, as applicable, through an entity, which is part of the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;

Article: Article 63: Tier 2 instruments
Content: (ii) the proceeds are immediately available to the institution without limitation in a form that satisfies the conditions laid down in this paragraph.

Article: Article 64: Amortisation of Tier 2 instruments
Content: The extent to which Tier 2 instruments qualify as Tier 2 items during the final five years of maturity of the instruments is calculated by multiplying the result derived from the calculation in point (a) by the amount referred to in point (b) as follows:

Article: Article 64: Amortisation of Tier 2 instruments
Content: (a) the nominal amount of the instruments or subordinated loans on the first day of the final five year period of their contractual maturity divided by the number of calendar days in that period;

Article: Article 64: Amortisation of Tier 2 instruments
Content: (b) the number of remaining calendar days of contractual maturity of the instruments or subordinated loans.

Article: Article 65: Consequences of the conditions for Tier 2 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: Where in the case of a Tier 2 instrument the conditions laid down in Article 63 cease to be met, the following shall apply:

Article: Article 65: Consequences of the conditions for Tier 2 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: (a) that instrument shall immediately cease to qualify as a Tier 2 instrument;

Article: Article 65: Consequences of the conditions for Tier 2 instruments ceasing to be met
Content: (b) the part of the share premium accounts that relate to that instrument shall immediately cease to qualify as Tier 2 items.

Article: Article 66: Deductions from Tier 2 items
Content: The following shall be deducted from Tier 2 items:

Article: Article 66: Deductions from Tier 2 items
Content: (a) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by an institution of own Tier 2 instruments, including own Tier 2 instruments that an institution could be obliged to purchase as a result of existing contractual obligations;

Article: Article 66: Deductions from Tier 2 items
Content: (b) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of the Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities with which the institution has reciprocal cross holdings that the competent authority considers to have been designed to inflate artificially the own funds of the institution;

Article: Article 66: Deductions from Tier 2 items
Content: (c) the applicable amount determined in accordance with Article 70 of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of the Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities, where an institution does not have a significant investment in those entities;

Article: Article 66: Deductions from Tier 2 items
Content: (d) direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities where the institution has a significant investment in those entities, excluding underwriting positions held for fewer than five working days.

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: For the purposes of point (a) of Article 66, institutions shall calculate holdings on the basis of the gross long positions subject to the following exceptions:

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (a) institutions may calculate the amount of holdings on the basis of the net long position provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (i) the long and short positions are in the same underlying exposure and the short positions involve no counterparty risk;

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (ii) either both the long and the short positions are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book;

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (b) institutions shall determine the amount to be deducted for direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of index securities by calculating the underlying exposure to own Tier 2 instruments in those indices;

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (c) institutions may net gross long positions in own Tier 2 instruments resulting from holdings of index securities against short positions in own Tier 2 instruments resulting from short positions in the underlying indices, including where those short positions involve counterparty risk, provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (i) the long and short positions are in the same underlying indices;

Article: Article 67: Deductions of holdings of own Tier 2 instruments
Content: (ii) either both the long and the short positions are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book.

Article: Article 68: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities and where an institution...
Content: Institutions shall make the deductions required by points (b), (c) and (d) of Article 66 in accordance with the following provisions:

Article: Article 68: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities and where an institution...
Content: (a) holdings of Tier 2 instruments shall be calculated on the basis of the gross long positions;

Article: Article 68: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities and where an institution...
Content: (b) holdings of Tier 2 own-fund insurance items and Tier 3 own-fund insurance items shall be treated as holdings of Tier 2 instruments for the purposes of deduction.

Article: Article 69: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: Institutions shall make the deductions required by points (c) and (d) of Article 66 in accordance with the following:

Article: Article 69: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (a) they may calculate direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of Tier 2 instruments of the financial sector entities on the basis of the net long position in the same underlying exposure provided that both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 69: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (i) the maturity of the short position matches the maturity of the long position or has a residual maturity of at least one year;

Article: Article 69: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (ii) either both the long position and the short position are held in the trading book or both are held in the nontrading book;

Article: Article 69: Deduction of holdings of Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities
Content: (b) they shall determine the amount to be deducted for direct, indirect and synthetic holdings of index securities by looking through to the underlying exposure to the capital instruments of the financial sector entities in those indices.

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: 1. For the purposes of point (c) of Article 66, institutions shall calculate the applicable amount to be deducted by multiplying the amount referred to in point (a) of this paragraph by the factor derived from the calculation referred to in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (a) the aggregate amount by which the direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment exceeds 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution calculated after applying the following:

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (i) Articles 32 to 35;

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (ii) points (a) to (g), points (k)(ii) to (v) and point (l) of Article 36(1), excluding the amount to be deducted for deferred tax assets that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences;

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (iii) Articles 44 and 45;

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (b) the amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment divided by the aggregate amount of all direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of those financial sector entities.

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: 2. Institutions shall exclude underwriting positions held for five working days or fewer from the amount referred to in point (a) of paragraph 1 and from the calculation of the factor referred to in point (b) of paragraph 1.

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: 3. The amount to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be apportioned across each Tier 2 instrument held. Institutions shall determine the amount to be deducted from each Tier 2 instrument that is deducted pursuant to paragraph 1 by multiplying the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the proportion specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (a) the total amount of holdings required to be deducted pursuant to paragraph 1;

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (b) the proportion of the aggregate amount of direct, indirect and synthetic holdings by the institution of the Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities in which the institution does not have a significant investment represented by each Tier 2 instrument held.

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: 4. The amount of holdings referred to in point (c) of Article 66(1) that is equal to or less than 10 % of the Common Equity Tier 1 items of the institution after applying the provisions laid down in points (a)(i) to (iii) of paragraph 1 shall not be deducted and shall be subject to the applicable risk weights in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three and the requirements laid down in Title IV of Part Three, as applicable.

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: 5. Institutions shall determine the amount of each Tier 2 instrument that is risk weighted pursuant to paragraph 4 by multiplying the amount specified in point (a) of this paragraph by the amount specified in point (b) of this paragraph:

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (a) the amount of holdings required to be risk weighted pursuant to paragraph 4;

Article: Article 70: Deduction of Tier 2 instruments where an institution does not have a significant investment in a...
Content: (b) the proportion resulting from the calculation in point (b) of paragraph 3.

Article: Article 71: Tier 2 capital
Content: The Tier 2 capital of an institution shall consist of the Tier 2 items of the institution after the deductions referred to in Article 66 and the application of Article 79.

Article: Article 72: Own funds
Content: The own funds of an institution shall consist of the sum of its Tier 1 capital and Tier 2 capital.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 1. Capital instruments for which an institution has the sole discretion to decide to pay distributions in a form other than cash or an own funds instrument shall not be capable of qualifying as Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments unless the institution has received the prior permission of the competent authorities.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 2. Competent authorities shall grant the permission referred to in paragraph 1 only where they consider all the following conditions to be met:

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: (a) the ability of the institution to cancel payments under the instrument would not be adversely affected by the discretion referred to in paragraph 1, or by the form in which distributions could be made;

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: (b) the ability of the instrument to absorb losses would not be adversely affected by the discretion referred to in paragraph 1, or by the form in which distributions could be made;

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: (c) the quality of the capital instrument would not otherwise be reduced by the discretion referred to in paragraph 1, or by the form in which distributions could be made.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 3. Capital instruments for which a legal person other than the institution issuing them has the discretion to decide or require that the payment of distributions on the instrument shall be made in a form other than cash or an own funds instrument shall not be capable of qualifying as Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 4. Institutions may use a broad market index as one of the bases for determining the level of distributions on Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 5. Paragraph 4 shall not apply where the institution is a reference entity in that broad market index unless both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: (a) the institution considers movements in that broad market index not to be significantly correlated to the credit standing of the institution, its parent institution or parent financial holding company or parent mixed financial holding company or parent mixed activity holding company;

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: (b) the competent authority has not reached a different determination from that referred to in point (a).

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 6. Institutions shall report and disclose the broad market indices on which their capital instruments rely.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: 7. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the conditions according to which indices shall be deemed to qualify as broad market indices for the purposes of paragraph 4.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 73: Distributions on own funds instruments
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 74: Holdings of capital instruments issued by regulated financial sector entities that do not qualify...
Content: Institutions shall not deduct from any element of own funds direct, indirect or synthetic holdings of capital instruments issued by a regulated financial sector entity that do not qualify as regulatory capital of that entity. Institutions shall apply risk weights to such holdings in accordance with Chapter 2 or 3 of Title II of Part Three, as applicable.

Article: Article 75: Deduction and maturity requirements for short positions
Content: The maturity requirements for short positions referred to in point (a) of Article 45, point (a) of Article 59 and point (a) of Article 69 shall be deemed to be met in respect of positions held where the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 75: Deduction and maturity requirements for short positions
Content: (a) the institution has the contractual right to sell on a specific future date to the counterparty providing the hedge the long position that is being hedged;

Article: Article 75: Deduction and maturity requirements for short positions
Content: (b) the counterparty providing the hedge to the institution is contractually obliged to purchase from the institution on that specific future date the long position referred to in point (a).

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: 1. For the purposes of point (a) of Article 42, point (a) of Article 45, point (a) of Article 57, point (a) of Article 59, point (a) of Article 67 and point (a) of Article 69, institutions may reduce the amount of a long position in a capital instrument by the portion of an index that is made up of the same underlying exposure that is being hedged, provided that the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (a) either both the long position being hedged and the short position in an index used to hedge that long position are held in the trading book or both are held in the non-trading book;

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (b) the positions referred to in point (a) are held at fair value on the balance sheet of the institution;

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (c) the short position referred to in point (a) qualifies as an effective hedge under the internal control processes of the institution;

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (d) the competent authorities assess the adequacy of the control processes referred to in point (c) on at least an annual basis and are satisfied with their continuing appropriateness.

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: 2. Where the competent authority has given its prior permission, an institution may use a conservative estimate of the underlying exposure of the institution to capital instruments included in indices as an alternative to an institution calculating its exposure to the items referred to in either or both of points (a) and (b):

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (a) own Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments included in indices;

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (b) Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments of financial sector entities, included in indices.

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: 3. Competent authorities shall grant the permission referred to in paragraph 2 only where the institution has demonstrated to their satisfaction that it would be operationally burdensome for the institution to monitor its underlying exposure to the items referred to in one or both of point (a) or (b) of paragraph 2, as applicable.

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: 4. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify:

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (a) when an estimate used as an alternative to the calculation of underlying exposure referred to in paragraph 2 is sufficiently conservative;

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: (b) the meaning of operationally burdensome for the purposes of paragraph 3.

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 76: Index holdings of capital instruments
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 77: Conditions for reducing own funds
Content: An institution shall require the prior permission of the competent authority to do either or both of the following:

Article: Article 77: Conditions for reducing own funds
Content: (a) reduce, redeem or repurchase Common Equity Tier 1 instruments issued by the institution in a manner that is permitted under applicable national law;

Article: Article 77: Conditions for reducing own funds
Content: (b) effect the call, redemption, repayment or repurchase of Additional Tier 1 instruments or Tier 2 instruments as applicable, prior to the date of their contractual maturity.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: 1. The competent authority shall grant permission for an institution to reduce, repurchase, call or redeem Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments where either of the following conditions is met:

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (a) earlier than or at the same time as the action referred to in Article 77, the institution replaces the instruments referred to in Article 77 with own funds instruments of equal or higher quality at terms that are sustainable for the income capacity of the institution;

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (b) the institution has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the competent authority that the own funds of the institution would, following the action in question, exceed the requirements laid down in Article 92(1) of this Regulation and the combined buffer requirement as defined in point (6) of Article 128 of Directive 2013/36/EU by a margin that the competent authority may consider necessary on the basis of Article 104(3) of Directive 2013/36/EU.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: 2. When assessing under point (a) of paragraph 1 the sustainability of the replacement instruments for the income capacity of the institution, competent authorities shall consider the extent to which those replacement capital instruments would be more costly for the institution than those they would replace.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: 3. Where an institution takes an action referred to in point (a) of Article 77 and the refusal of redemption of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments referred to in Article 27 is prohibited by applicable national law, the competent authority may waive the conditions laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article provided that the competent authority requires the institution to limit the redemption of such instruments on an appropriate basis.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: 4. The competent authorities may permit institutions to redeem Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments before five years of the date of issue only where the conditions laid down in paragraph 1 and point (a) or (b) of this paragraph are met:

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (a) there is a change in the regulatory classification of those instruments that would be likely to result in their exclusion from own funds or reclassification as a lower quality form of own funds, and both the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (i) the competent authority considers such a change to be sufficiently certain;

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (ii) the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the competent authorities that the regulatory reclassification of those instruments was not reasonably foreseeable at the time of their issuance;

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (b) there is a change in the applicable tax treatment of those instruments which the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the competent authorities is material and was not reasonably foreseeable at the time of their issuance.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: 5. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following:

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (a) the meaning of sustainable for the income capacity of the institution;

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (b) the appropriate bases of limitation of redemption referred to in paragraph 3;

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: (c) the process and data requirements for an application by an institution for the permission of the competent authority to carry out an action listed in Article 77, including the process to be applied in the case of redemption of shares issued to members of cooperative societies, and the time period for processing such an application.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 78: Supervisory permission for reducing own funds
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 79: Temporary waiver of deduction from own funds
Content: 1. Where an institution holds capital instruments or has granted subordinated loans, as applicable, that qualify as Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments in a financial sector entity temporarily and the competent authority deems those holdings to be for the purposes of a financial assistance operation designed to reorganise and save that entity, the competent authority may waive on a temporary basis the provisions on deduction that would otherwise apply to those instruments.

Article: Article 79: Temporary waiver of deduction from own funds
Content: 2. EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the concept of temporary for the purposes of paragraph 1 and the conditions according to which a competent authority may deem those temporary holdings to be for the purposes of a financial assistance operation designed to reorganise and save a relevant entity.

Article: Article 79: Temporary waiver of deduction from own funds
Content: EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 28 July 2013.

Article: Article 79: Temporary waiver of deduction from own funds
Content: Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/ 2010.

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: 1. EBA shall monitor the quality of own funds instruments issued by institutions across the Union and shall notify the Commission immediately where there is significant evidence of those instruments not meeting the criteria set out in Article 28 or, where applicable, Article 29.

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: Competent authorities shall, without delay, upon request by EBA, forward all information that EBA deems relevant concerning new capital instruments issued in order to enable EBA to monitor the quality of own funds instruments issued by institutions across the Union.

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: 2. A notification shall include the following:

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: (a) a detailed explanation of the nature and extent of the shortfall identified;

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: (b) technical advice on the action by the Commission that EBA considers to be necessary;

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: (c) significant developments in the methodology of EBA for stress testing the solvency of institutions.

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: 3. EBA shall provide technical advice to the Commission on any significant changes it considers to be required to the definition of own funds as a result of any of the following:

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: (a) relevant developments in market standards or practice;

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: (b) changes in relevant legal or accounting standards;

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: (c) significant developments in the methodology of EBA for stress testing the solvency of institutions.

Article: Article 80: Continuing review of quality of own funds
Content: 4. EBA shall provide technical advice to the Commission by 1 January 2014 on possible treatments of unrealised gains measured at fair value other than including them in Common Equity Tier 1 without adjustment. Such recommendations shall take into account relevant developments in international accounting standards and in international agreements on prudential standards for banks.

Title: TITLE II: MINORITY INTEREST AND ADDITIONAL TIER 1 AND TIER 2 INSTRUMENTS ISSUED BY SUBSIDIARIES

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: 1. Minority interests shall comprise the sum of Common Equity Tier 1 instruments, the share premium accounts related to those instruments, retained earnings and other reserves of a subsidiary where the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: (a) the subsidiary is one of the following:

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: (i) an institution;

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: (ii) an undertaking that is subject by virtue of applicable national law to the requirements of this Regulation and Directive 2013/36/EU;

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: (b) the subsidiary is included fully in the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: (c) the Common Equity Tier 1 items, referred to in the introductory part of this paragraph are owned by persons other than the undertakings included in the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One.

Article: Article 81: Minority interests that qualify for inclusion in consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital
Content: 2. Minority interests that are funded directly or indirectly, through a special purpose entity or otherwise, by the parent undertaking of the institution, or its subsidiaries shall not qualify as consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 capital.

Article: Article 82: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds
Content: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds shall comprise the minority interest, Additional Tier 1 or Tier 2 instruments, as applicable, plus the related retained earnings and share premium accounts, of a subsidiary where the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 82: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds
Content: (a) the subsidiary is either of the following:

Article: Article 82: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds
Content: (i) an institution;

Article: Article 82: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds
Content: (ii) an undertaking that is subject by virtue of applicable national law to the requirements of this Regulation and Directive 2013/36/EU;

Article: Article 82: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds
Content: (b) the subsidiary is included fully in the scope of consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;

Article: Article 82: Qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1, Tier 2 capital and qualifying own funds
Content: (c) those instruments are owned by persons other than the undertakings included in the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One.

Article: Article 83: Qualifying Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital issued by a special purpose entity
Content: 1. Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments issued by a special purpose entity, and the related share premium accounts, are included in qualifying Additional Tier 1, Tier 1 or Tier 2 capital or qualifying own funds, as applicable, only where the following conditions are met:

Article: Article 83: Qualifying Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital issued by a special purpose entity
Content: (a) the special purpose entity issuing those instruments is included fully in the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;

Article: Article 83: Qualifying Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital issued by a special purpose entity
Content: (b) the instruments, and the related share premium accounts, are included in qualifying Additional Tier 1 capital only where the conditions laid down in Article 52(1) are satisfied;

Article: Article 83: Qualifying Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital issued by a special purpose entity
Content: (c) the instruments, and the related share premium accounts, are included in qualifying Tier 2 capital only where the conditions laid down in Article 63 are satisfied;

Article: Article 83: Qualifying Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital issued by a special purpose entity
Content: (d) the only asset of the special purpose entity is its investment in the own funds of the parent undertaking or a subsidiary thereof that is included fully in the consolidation pursuant to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One, the form of which satisfies the relevant conditions laid down in Articles 52(1) or 63, as applicable.
